Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2013 08:05PM Lezza13 wrote: Thanks to all of you ladies who answered my posts.  The drains are due to come out within seven days so I hope to be off pain meds by then. Healing will happen with time and yes, I am happy to be flat and free with a little nip and tuck later this year. Wishing all of you the best of everything. I shall have to change my signature.  All the best!
Posts.Title: Implants removal with no Reconstructions- Scared Lezza13 Mommyathome

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2013 07:39PM Lezza13 wrote: Hi Ladies Thanks for all your answers. PiperPete:  I have checked out the website and have seen the pictures.  That has given me the idea and I know I am not alone by any means with my decision.  I do like the website and I appreciate your comments coraleliz:  She said she could not make me totally flat.  I am pretty concave now with the AA fake implants.  I suppose the rest should not matter. crystalphm: thanks for the comments. I think that is what has happened to me. I cover my implants now and I can see not having them. I agree being cancer free and pain free is most important and no more mammograms. I will just have to accept who I am.  Pain fee is my motivator, getting used to my "new" me will take a bit of time Momine- I chose recon because of the way she said I would look.  I am pretty concave now since I went from a DD to AA in implants.  Lots of chest wall was removed with the tumor but that is the good news.  I will just have to get used to being flat and live with it just like everyone else. The positive is that I want to be pain free and not care about fake breasts or any recon jobs.  I can always wear those foobs but I doubt I will. Thanks for the imput
Posts.Title: Implants removal with no Reconstructions- Scared Lezza13 Mommyathome

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2013 01:59PM Lezza13 wrote: katlebbie  Thanks for the nice wishes. One more revision surgery out to do it.  I would think insurance would cover what you are going through the contracture regardless of how long its been and its up to you if you want to replace it or not. Hope you make a decision that is best for you. SunflowerMa.  Thanks.  Mine is "settling" too. I hope yours settles sooner than later Yes I agree! IT FEELS GREAT TO BE FLAT LIKE A GIRL BEFORE BOOBS!   I just need my PS and I to agree on the amount of tissue to be removed during the revision just for the symmetry. dogsandjogs: best of luck with you and do keep us updated on your decision.  Sending a cyberhug! Sending cyber hugs to all
Posts.Title: Implants removal with no Reconstructions- Scared Lezza13 Mommyathome

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2013 07:49PM Lezza13 wrote: Hi Ladies. I would have posted sooner but I just had surgery on the 17th to remove the implants. Sunflower, I don't know how you were able to do it in the office.  There is no way I could have mastered that. I have two drains and am happy to be without the painful implants but I needed the recovery room support and lots of pain medicaiton.  Thank you though.  Three days out and I feel so much lighter without the implants. HAPPY is the key word. I think I will stick with cami and not silcone foobs or nothings.  My own breasts were big too so I think my old bras might work on their own. I am in my 50's and will be happyto be pain free. I appreciate all fo your comments dogsandjogs:  All of it should be covered. I just had to pay the hosptial my coinsurance, that was it. Piper Pete My PS did say she might have to fix a flap or bump in her office in a few months this surgery But she said  it is such a minor proceduce to nip and tuck.  It so nice not to feel those painful implants inside. Nancy:  Sorry you have had to go through with so much. I agree with sunflower. I would go for the masectomy.  To me comfort and pain free was my goal getting these implants out and I am happy with my decision.
Posts.Title: Implants removal with no Reconstructions- Scared Lezza13 Mommyathome

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2013 09:04PM Lezza13 wrote: SunflowersMA:  thanks for letting me know it takes time for "things to settle"  I am seven days post op and want to see the results so it is great to know I need to  have some patience.  Yes, I agree:  It is so so good to be without them.  Nice to know someone that feels the same relief I do.
Posts.Title: Implants removal with no Reconstructions- Scared Lezza13 Mommyathome

Posts.Content: Lezza13 wrote: Hi Ladies I am having my saline implants removed in two weeks. They have been so uncomfortable since my BMX last year.  I am not having any new ones put in. So I will be "caved in" according to my PS.  I am not sure how to take her words.  I know I will be flat and I want that.  I will have two drains.  Not too sure how long they will last. This is my second round with drains.  I am one year cancer free.  I am  looking for a bit of support from women who are comfortable living without reconstruction.   Please let me know what I can expect being flat instead of "caved in". Dx 12/30/2011, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 2/23 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 2/27/2012 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Left, Right Hormonal Therapy 7/16/2012 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Log in to post a reply

GeorgiaMom  I guess I will try Prilosec for this nasty heartburn.  I have the tri pack of elum for nausea.  And Zolfran.  Glad #4 is working good for you.  Hopefully this number three will be easier on me than the 2nd as far as the "D" train. Posts.Content: May 14, 2012 09:54PM Lezza13 wrote: StaySbiny Thanks I took one last night just to be sure!  I take Zantac for heartburn 2x day  Tagamet and Pepcid did not work after awhile.  Each one is different.  Go for the veggies!  I know noithing about taste enhancers I hate steroids with ttreatments.  Makes my hands shake and restless. Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 18, 2012 06:59PM Lezza13 wrote: Lynbea- I am on TC#3 as well.  I rode that D train the last two rounds .  I take lomotil that my onc gave me to take when I went too often.  Immodium can help.  Bananas, apples, rice, sweet potatoes toast, mashed potatoes and no milk products is what helped me.  Also a probiotic every day.   Hope it slows down. Hope the tea tree oil helps with the nails.  Whatever works, go for it!  Hope you feel better
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 21, 2012 01:19PM Lezza13 wrote: Hi Ladies:  I love shopping therapy!!  Especially thrift stores, more bang for the buck LOL StayShiny: Aquafor seems to help with my skin.   Also, my onc told me today to put Udder cream on my feet twice of day since they are red and hurt.  And to stay in sandles or crocs and out of my tennis shoes and socks.  I sweat pretty heavy so this is a challenge for me. Also excessive walking can irritate your feet.  Oh, BTW  you were very brave to have lats done.  I had a BMX with expanders only. That is what my BS wanted me to do.  Now I am going for implants only in July. DianneNC  Sorry to hear about your failed DIEP. There are lots of threads about bras and such on this sight..  What great news about the cruise and a wonderful way to start a new year. Welcome DorMac to this group.  Glad your SE's are minimal.  I have never heard of that. Perhaps one of the other great women on this thread will chime in.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 22, 2012 06:55PM Lezza13 wrote: StayShiny:  Glad your heels are doing better.  Glad you are able to use the bike with no socks.   I like socks too. They just have to come off now and then.  These Texas summers are just too hot and humid for me. Thanks for the elevation tip.  I heard about recliners on this thread and bought one.  It has been my bed for five months now since my BMX.  My poor DH can't wait for my final surgery in July  LOL  Hope you PT appt goes well and your son's concert!  Jenny: welcome to this thread.  You are getting awesome advice and I agree with the above posts.Be glad you have your port. Sometimes I get my blood drawn that way too.   The first one is the longest and we all got through it. So can you!

Hopefully it will go away.  Yes, I do what you try rubbing my fingers on my clothes.  That has worked so far.  Hope your heels heal soon and thanks for the tips.  Hope our last round is our easiest!

Wrong!  This is day 3 and I woke up with a fever.  Had to go in for fluids.  My onc likes me to do this if I had a bad night.  The infusion nurse wants me to come back on Friday too.  After Round 1 I was in the hospital for 4 days so I go when they tell me to go in for fluids. hiker61: I have IBS too.  Oh, how this chemo kicks a digestive system.   I was so sorry to hear about that poking. You had me crying.  I have been through it too. Sorry to hear about your father in law rachel11: the hair is different with most people.  Mine started coming out right before round 2.  I shaved it two weeks before round 3  Sorry to hear about your grandmother. I think you will be fine that day Stayshiny: Thanks for the wishes.  Hope your heel heals fast.  Melrosemelrose:  I have the same book. Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2012 03:22PM Lezza13 wrote: Melrosemelrose.  I will be thinking about you in that big girl chair tomorrow.  I take Claritin the night before my Nuelasta shot. and then for 5 days after.  My shot is Wed as well. Seems to help with the bone pain.  Wanted to make sure you knew about that  I was told Advil works better than tylenol for that type of pain. Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2012 08:08PM Lezza13 wrote: StayShiny. Feet have two blisters. Healed. Onc said it was my shoes fault. lol. I do the cream 2times daily and l-glutamine and elevation. So far ok. Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2012 01:09PM Lezza13 wrote: I know it has been awhile since I put on a post but #4 is kicking my butt.  The neulasta shot gives me ringing in my ears in the sound of a heartbeat, constantly with no relief.  I am extremely tired with a constant headache. So sleeping has been tough.  I forgot about this extreme fatigue and miss the week before chemo. Just knowing I have to wait two more weeks to feel better seems like forever.  Thanks for listening. I know this is a safe place to vent. StayShiny: I know how you feel about being a little down after the last one. Is this all there is? My onc is talking about rads  but he never mentioned it in the beginning so it is not happening now. Time to change my onc.  The one that says the sores on my feet are due to my shoes!!  Escape into a novel is a great idea!  Congrats on your daugther graduating! Melrosemelrose: Thanks for all the food tips. I try eating every two hours, nuts, yogurt that type of thing.  I have a cookbook too, but do not feel like cooking these days.  Losing wait is not the worse SE by no means! Congrats to all of the moms of graduates! Just hoping the next day is better than this one, cause yesterday was tough and today is not much better! LOL  Here's to better days and minimal SE's to all.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

I use Udder Cream daily and stick with the l-glutamine. Hopefully they will heal iwth time too. Summer51.  Yes, I took the Claritin the night before and 7 days after.  It did seem to help this round. StayShiny. Glad those silly heals are better.  Hope you get your energy back

Posts.Content: May 16, 2012 12:18PM Lezza13 wrote: Janiemomof2:  Hope you feel better.  That is what happened with TC round 1 with me. I had such bad case of the runs my onc put me in the hospital for fluids because my WBC was so low.  I was there 4 days  I take Lomotil now after so many trips to the bathroom.  It has helped me.  Round 2 was the same. except I took lomotil more often.  Wishing you better days  I am on Round 3 of TC and I  have the opposite problem with consitpation. I was so afraid of fiber, I avoided it for a long time and now I pay the price. My onc said no milk products so I am slowly adding fiber back into my diet. it is amazing how these Rounds affect each of us differently.. Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2012 08:28PM Lezza13 wrote: Melrosemelrose:  Good luck toomorrow.  I heard about the Claritin from this thread.  I hope the trials go well for you after your last TC and the best wishes with them!  And yes, minimal SE's for both of us!  StayShiny- Thank you for the wishes!  Neulasta- my feelings about the shot:  I did not get a shot after round 1 and it put me in the hospital for 4 days the following week due to a low WBC. Took 4 days and lots of shots to boost it back up!  Now I get the shot the day after each round and take my Claritin the night before and for 5 days after. If I feel dehydrated the first day or two I go in just for fluids

Posts.Content: May 29, 2019 09:14AM Lezza13 wrote: aliciacantu84 - everything you are experiencing is normal. It all is tolerable and it comes and goes. I sometimes will just rub the areas of the scars and that seems to help. . I am sure you can find ways to deal with it. It is annoying for sure MBPooch- the tightness under my arms seems to linger. Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2013 07:54PM Lezza13 wrote: Hi MaggiPgh Thanks for sharing everything y ou have gone through.  I am having my implants removed on the 16th of this month because of pain after my BMX last year.  I appreciate you sharing your experiences because now I know what to expect.  I do expect to be flat but at least a little more pain free. Thanks for sharing. By the way:  I have had PT and it does not hurt if it is done by one of those lymphdema specialist. I don't have that.  I have a frozen shoulder and cording.  It feels wonderful. I just wish I culd afford it.  Maybe after my surgery I can try PT again. How long were your drains in?  How long before you were able to drive?  Thanks   Lezza
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2013 09:11AM Lezza13 wrote: lala1  Still getting them out.  They roll out when I lay down and it hurts when I sleep in a bed.  I did not have any fills with my implants so they are hard double aa's that are very uncomfortable.  That is besides the pain from the BMX and the frozen shoulder.  I am asking my BS for PT as well for therapy for my shoulder after the surgery.  I understand the benefits of PT and am glad it is working for you.  I expect pain to still be there from the original BMX but I will be happy to be flat and free of these nasty implants.  I will look into PT later for my shoulder.
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2019 12:53PM Lezza13 wrote: I would get a second opinion. I had a bilateral mastectomy with no radiation. I had 2 positive lymph nodes but 23 were removed. The radiation doctor said I did not need radiation. Nor did I want it. Keep asking and best of luck
Posts.Title: Having bilateral mastectomy & want to refuse radiation after. Rkelmarie DesertPup

Posts.Content: May 3, 2012 02:57PM Lezza13 wrote: Nice to see this thread.  My husband is totally supportive of my double masectomy.  I have chosen not to reconstruct and can't wait for the "expanders" to leave after chemo.  I do love hugs. Hugs back.
Posts.Title: What does your husband/loved one think about your flatness? otter otter

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2019 09:34AM Lezza13 wrote: I think waiting for the MRI biopsy results is tough but those results might give you the answer you need to have the procedure. I had dense breasts even more after having my twins years ago. Then I went through several scares of biopsies on my left breast. I was diagnosed at the six month checkup on yet another one in my left breast. My right one had a i cm cancer. I had three positive lymph nodes so both breasts were gone. I was tired of the repeated scares and am happy with my decision. I tried reconstruction but it was not for me. It is of course your decision. I am sure you will choose however you feel most comfortable with. Best of luck,
Posts.Title: Would you seek a Prophylactic bilateral mastectomy if...? Martha615 Dm39
